# Veterinary Services for Aquatic Life Research Facility
### Solicitation Number: 5000075637

#### Background
Environment and Climate Change Canada is seeking a veterinary service provider to care for all vertebrate animals held and treated by staff at the Aquatic Life Research Facility (ALRF) located at the Canada Centre for Inland Waters in Burlington, Ontario, and participate as the required veterinarian member of the Ontario and Québec Region Aquatic Animal Care Committee (ACC) for the fiscal years 2024-25 to 2029-30.

#### Scope of Work
The successful bidder will provide veterinary care services, including preventative medication services, for the ALRF and participate in the ACC for the specified period. The services will be provided in accordance with the prescribed guidelines and standards.

#### Evaluation Criteria
The bid will be evaluated based on the highest combined rating of technical merit (60%) and price (40%).

#### Contract Period
The contract is expected to commence on April 1, 2024, and terminate on March 31, 2030.

#### Funding
The total funding for this project has been established at the following maximum amounts:

| Year | Funding Amount |
| --- | --- |
| 2024-25 | $15,234.00 CAD (applicable taxes excluded) |
| 2025-26 | $15,615.00 CAD (applicable taxes excluded) |
| 2026-27 | $16,544.00 CAD (applicable taxes excluded) |
| 2027-28 | $16,405.00 CAD (applicable taxes excluded) |
| 2028-29 | $16,816.00 CAD (applicable taxes excluded) |
| 2029-30 | $17,788.00 CAD (applicable taxes excluded) |

#### Language of Communication
Environment and Climate Change Canada offers procurement services in both official languages, English and French. Bidders may submit their bid in the language of their choice.

#### Additional Information
For additional information or to request a debriefing on the bid solicitation process, please contact Michel Larivière at michel.larivière@ec.gc.ca or (819) 938-3816.

### Required Documents
The following documents are required as part of the bid submission:

* Mandatory tender form
* Technical proposal
* Price proposal
* Proof of insurance

### Submitting a Bid
Bidders must submit their bid electronically through the Canadabuys Platform. The deadline for submission is December
